newsitem.title: MALTA: Malta to hold general election October 26. [corrected 13:57 gmt]
newsitem.headline: Malta to hold general election October 26. [corrected 13:57 gmt]

text.p: Maltese Prime Minister Edward Fenech Adami announced on Monday that general elections would be held on October 26, eight months before the expiry of his mandate.
Fenech Adami told a news conference he had advised President Ugo Mifsud Bonnici to dissolve parliament as from Monday.
Parliament was due to reconvene on Monday after the summer recess.

The Nationalist Party led by Fenech Adami has a three-seat majority in the 65-seat parliament. It has been in power since February 1987, applied for membership of the European Union in 1990 (corrects from 1989), and was returned to power in 1992 elections.
Elections had to be held by the end of June next year but have widely been expected earlier.
Unofficial campaigning has already started, with the opposition Labour Party, headed by Alfred Sant, on Monday being quoted as saying his party would provide "a government for all the people".
